titleStmt.title: The sad and dolefull lamentation of Origen after his fall: set up as a seamark to make others beware of doing the least evil, that good (even the greatest good) may come of it.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by D.M., and are to be given at James Crump's, in Little Bartholomews Well-yard.,

notesStmt.note: "An imperfect fragment, wanting all before p. 9." Cf. British Library.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: James Crump's, in Little Bartholomews Well-yard.
